meanings.sent1: She was lisping her words due to her missing front teeth.
meanings.sent2: The little boy was lisping as he tried to say his name.
meanings.sent3: The lisping sound of the wind through the trees made her giggle.
meanings.sent4: His lisping voice was like a gentle melody in the room.
meanings.sent5: The lisping of the stream over the rocks was soothing to her ears.

meanings.definition: The act of speaking with a lisp.
meanings.sent1: Her lisping was noticeable when she pronounced 's' sounds.
meanings.sent2: The teacher helped the student overcome his lisping with speech therapy.
meanings.sent3: The lisping in the play added a comedic touch to the character's speech.
meanings.sent4: His lisping was a barrier to clear communication in the noisy room.
meanings.sent5: The lisping of the old man brought a unique charm to his storytelling.
